title: Cola fountains: a nucleation spectacular

multiple-choice.question: What is the main theory behind the reaction between the candy and the soda, as described by the MythBusters?

options.label: A
options.text: The sugar in the candy reacts with the carbonation in the soda.

options.label: B
options.text: The surface of the candy is covered with microscopic pits that provide nucleation sites for CO2 bubbles to form.

options.label: C
options.text: The acidity in the soda causes the candy to dissolve rapidly.

options.label: D
options.text: The temperature of the soda affects the rate of reaction with the candy.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of the control experiment in the MythBusters' investigation?

options.label: A
options.text: To test the effect of different types of soda on the reaction.

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: To test the effect of temperature on the reaction.

options.label: A
options.text: The colored Mentos are made by a different manufacturer.

options.label: B
options.text: The colored Mentos have a glazing over them that inhibits the nucleation process.

options.label: C
options.text: The colored Mentos have a different shape than the regular mint Mentos.

options.label: D
options.text: The colored Mentos are sweeter than the regular mint Mentos.

multiple-choice.question: What happens when the smooth Mentos are dropped into the soda, according to the MythBusters?

options.label: A
options.text: There is a massive eruption of bubbles.

options.label: B
options.text: The soda becomes still and calm.

options.label: C
options.text: The soda remains unchanged.

options.label: D
options.text: There is a slight increase in bubbles, but not as much as with the regular mint Mentos.

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of the MythBusters' investigation, as stated in the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: The MythBusters were unable to determine the cause of the reaction.

options.label: B
options.text: The MythBusters found that the reaction is due to the acidity in the soda.

options.label: C
options.text: The MythBusters cracked the case of the candy and cola Cascade.

options.label: D
options.text: The MythBusters found that the reaction is due to the temperature of the soda.

title: Why do fingers become pruney? - Mark Changizi

multiple-choice.question: What did doctors notice in the emergency room in the 1930s that might have sparked the question, "Why do my fingers get all pruney when they're wet?"

options.label: A
options.text: Patients with nerve damage to their hands did not get pruney fingertips.

options.label: B
options.text: Patients with nerve damage to their hands got pruney fingertips more often.

options.label: C
options.text: Patients with nerve damage to their hands had smooth fingertips.

options.label: D
options.text: Patients with nerve damage to their hands had no connection to pruney fingertips.

multiple-choice.question: What is a predicted wrinkle shape for pruney fingers if they are like rain treads?

options.label: A
options.text: A tree network of divides with their trunk near the top of the fingertip and with their more leaky parts reaching out downhill, away from the tip.

options.label: B
options.text: A network of channels that connect to one another and diverge away from one another uphill.

options.label: C
options.text: A tree network of divides with their trunk uphill at the top of the promontory.

options.label: D
options.text: A network of channels that diverge away from one another downhill.

multiple-choice.question: What is a characteristic of river networks on convex promontories or protrusions?

options.label: A
options.text: The river channels are connected to one another and diverge away from one another uphill.

options.label: B
options.text: The river channels are disconnected from one another and diverge away from one another downhill.

options.label: C
options.text: The divides are disconnected from one another and diverge away from one another uphill.

options.label: D
options.text: The divides are connected to one another and diverge away from one another downhill.

multiple-choice.question: What is a result of having pruney fingers in a task where subjects had to grasp wet marbles and move them through a hole and out the other side?

options.label: A
options.text: Those with pruney fingers finished the task significantly slower than those with smooth fingers.

options.label: B
options.text: Those with pruney fingers finished the task at the same speed as those with smooth fingers.

options.label: C
options.text: Those with pruney fingers finished the task significantly faster than those with smooth fingers.

options.label: D
options.text: Those with pruney fingers were unable to finish the task.

multiple-choice.question: What might have been the reason for the evolution of pruney fingers in primates?

options.label: A
options.text: To deal with the dry, grip-heavy savannah habitats.

options.label: B
options.text: To deal with the especially challenging, often wet, grip-heavy forest habitats.

options.label: C
options.text: To deal with the cold, grip-heavy mountain habitats.

options.label: D
options.text: To deal with the hot, grip-heavy desert habitats.

options.label: B

options.label: B
options.text: A type of poll that asks questions in a way that is designed to sway the answers.

options.label: C

options.text: A type of poll that asks questions in a way that is designed to make the respondent feel uncomfortable.
